(THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OP HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENT.)SECRET.A Bill confirming the Customs Resolutions of the Manx legislature is passed annually.The Isli of Man has a separate financial existence levying its own taxes and defraying its own expenditure. In particular it is completely free as to Customs duties subject to confirmation by the Imperial Parliament. It would be unprecedented for parliament to alter the duties.The effect of the Resolutions to be confirmed by this Bill is to continue certain duties which are imposed in the Island annually and to apply to the Isle of Man modifications in the Customs tariff that are made in this country by the Finance Bill in the case of goods (other than sugar which is not dutiable in the Isle of Man) chargeable with duties under enactments other than the Import Duties Act. Duties under the Import Duties Act are imposed in the Isle of Man by Statutory Order not requiring confirmation ex post facto by the Imperial Parliament.
